content.raw:
1) I concur with the previous firehose issue that was raised where a gentle touch on any part of the hose starts the whole hose vibrating, which makes it move around and eventually fall off the table

2) My new issue is with the collision models. Quite frequently, i have been able to "impale" one of the fingers through what are supposedly solid parts of the hose. This includes the hose itself and the blue connector. Furthermore, once impaled, it is impossible to get it off the finger. I have attached pictures to show what is happening.

If this happens, there is no longer any way to manipulate the hose or connector.

Thank you,
Pat
content.html:
1) I concur with the previous firehose issue that was raised where a gentle touch on any part of the hose starts the whole hose vibrating, which makes it move around and eventually fall off the table

2) My new issue is with the collision models. Quite frequently, i have been able to "impale" one of the fingers through what are supposedly solid parts of the hose. This includes the hose itself and the blue connector. Furthermore, once impaled, it is impossible to get it off the finger. I have attached pictures to show what is happening.

If this happens, there is no longer any way to manipulate the hose or connector.

Thank you, Pat
